Package kaitech.model

Class BusinessImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • kaitech.model.BusinessImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Business
    public class BusinessImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Business
    Implementation of the Business interface; used to maintain state.

      • logIn

        public boolean logIn​(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.CharSequence attempt)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: Business
        Logs the user in given that the pin is correct.
        Specified by:
        logIn in interface Business
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the user.
        attempt - The user's entered CharSequence pin.
        Returns:
        A boolean, true is the user is now logged in, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the user is already logged in or the pin is unset.

      • logOut

        public void logOut()
        Description copied from interface: Business
        A method that logs the user out. This is done instead of a basic setter to increase security, such that calls like "business.setLoggedIn = true" are not possible.
        Specified by:
        logOut in interface Business

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Specified by:
        isLoggedIn in interface Business
        Returns:
        A boolean for whether the user is currently logged in.

      • setPin

        public void setPin​(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.CharSequence pin)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Business
        Sets the Business' PIN to a new value, which must be 4 in length and contain digits only.
        Specified by:
        setPin in interface Business
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the user associated with the pin.
        pin - The new CharSequence PIN.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the PIN contains non-numeric values or is shorter or longer than 4

      • getInstance

        public static Business getInstance()
        A method to obtain the main BusinessImpl object to implement the Singleton design pattern. If business is null, a new BusinessImpl is created. Returns the business, mainly for use by controllers.
        Returns:
        The Business object

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        A method to set the business back to null, mainly for testing purposes. Should be used with caution.

      • getIsPinEmpty

        public boolean getIsPinEmpty​(java.lang.String name)
        A getter to determine if a pin has been set yet, useful for the SetPinController
        Specified by:
        getIsPinEmpty in interface Business
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the business
        Returns:
        A boolean, true if the pin is null, false otherwise

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to search for in the Recipe of MenuItems.
        Returns:
